div1.p: Cuban Investigator Victim of His Investigations

div1.head: Newspaper clipping, February 7, [19--?]
div1.p:
Cuban Investigator Victim of His
Investigations.

Havana, Feb. 7.--The report of the Yel-
low Fever Board has been read before the
fever section of the Pan-American Medical
Congress. Two of the main conclusions
were that the specific cause of the disease
is unknown and that it can be only carried
by mosquitoes. Consequently, the disinfec-
tion of clothing and houses is useless.

The Board reported that non-immunes
were allowed to sleep in infected clothing
and bedding, but none contracted the dis-
ease. A member of the Congress objected
that these so-called non-immunes might
really have been immunes. The Board re-
plied that two of these were subsequently
subjected to the bites of infected mosqui-
toes and contracted the disease.

The moral aspect of the experiments was
touched upon. It was pointed out that
members of the Board were themselves
bitten and one of them died. Yellow fever
is not due to dirt. It may occur in the
cleanest localities.
